titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Northern Pacific Railway Company Maps and Drawings
Northern Pacific Railway Company Maps and Drawings
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:20

did.unittitle: Northern Pacific Railway Company maps and drawings

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Northern Pacific Railway Company Maps and Drawings are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Northern Pacific Railway Company Maps and Drawings. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Northern Pacific Railway Company, founded in 1864 and headquartered in Minnesota, constructed a railroad in the Western United States.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: June 1997 Acquisition and March 2000 Acquisition.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing in 2014, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Map titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the files in all cases.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
The dealer listing with detailed description for each map is available in box 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 105 manuscript maps and technical drawings documenting surveying for and construction of the Northern Pacific Railroad. The maps illustrate railroad development in Wisconsin, Minnesota, North Dakota, Montana, Idaho, Oregon, and Washington, as well as construction in several Indian reservations.
Accompanied by a vendor list with detailed description of maps 1-44 and 100-105 (in box 1).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Henry G. Taliaferro on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 1996 and the Winlock William Miller, Jr. Memorial Fund, 2000.

did.unittitle: June 1997 Acquisition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The title of each map includes the number supplied by the dealer. A list of the maps, with detailed descriptions by the dealer, is available in box 1.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat WA MS 227

did.unittitle: (NORTHERN PACIFIC R.R.) Johnson, Edwin F. Map showing the location of the Northern Pacific Railroad from its initial point on Lake Superior in Wisconsin to the Columbia River in Washington Territory. To accompany the certificate of the President and Engineer in Chief of this date July 26, 1870. New York City. Signed by J. Gregory Smith, President, and Edwin F. Johnson, Chief Engineer of the Northern Pacific R.R. Colored inks on oil cloth, 15 x 79". Notation in red ink in upper margin: "Received at the General Land Office, with Letter from the Secretary of the Interior, dated August 13, 1870." (Map 1)
(DAKOTA) Anderson, Adna. [Untitled map of a part of the Dakota Badlands.] Colored inks on oil cloth, 21-1/2 x 38-1/4". (Map 2)
(DAKOTA) Patterson, J. C., Surveyor. Elgin, Cass. Co., Dak. Pen and ink on oil cloth, 26 1/2 x 32". (Map 3)
(DAKOTA) [Anon.] Plan of Bartlett Ramsay Co., Dakota. Scale 20'=1". Blueprint, 21-1/2 x 36". (Map 4)
(DAKOTA) Groudel, John. Petersburg, Nelson Co., Dak. Scale 200 feet = 1 inch. Pen and ink on oil cloth, 23-1/2 x 40". (Map 5)
(DAKOTA) [Anon.] Casselton, Cass Co., n.d., Scale 1" = 200'. Ink and colored pencil on oil cloth, 24 x 28-3/4". (Map 6)
(DAKOTA) [Anon.] Larimore. Grand Forks County. Dakota [n.p.] Black and white lithograph printed on oil cloth, 19-3/4 x 29-3/4". (Map 7)
(DAKOTA) Hogeland, A. L. Located Line of the Dakota & Great Northern Railway Co. York to Dunseith. 1st Section Colored inks on oil cloth, 16 x 68". (Map 8)
(DAKOTA) Hogeland, A. L. Located Line of the Dakota & Great Northern Railway Co., York to Dunseith. 2nd Section. Colored inks on oil cloth, 16 x 68". (Map 9)

(IDAHO) Kendrick, J. W., Surveyor. Map Showing Definite Location of the Spokane & Palouse Ry. (Lewiston Extension). From Julietta to Lewiston Idaho Territory. Distance 24-1/lO Miles. Drawn by J. M. Gibboney. Assistant Engineer's Office, Tacoma, Washington. Scale 1 in.=2000 ft. Colored inks on oil cloth, 15-1/4 x 62-1/2". (Map 10)
(IDAHO & WASHINGTON) [Anon.] [Untitled map of northwestern Idaho and northeastern Washington]. Ink on oil cloth, 27-3/4 x 36-1/4". (Map 11)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Part of Anoka and Vicinity. Colored inks and pencil on oil cloth, 25-1/4 x 39". (Map 12)

(MINNESOTA) Morris, Charles. Map showing the location of the Brainerd Branch of the St. Paul and Pacific R.R. from Crow Wing to Brainerd. Scale 1 mile = 1 inch. Colored inks and pencil on oil cloth, 23 x 69". (Map 13)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] St. Paul Depot and Terminus Yard of the First Division St. Paul & Pacific R.R. Scale 100 ft.to one inch. Colored inks on oil cloth, 18-3/4 x 45". (Map 14)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Plat of Clearwater, Minn. Pen and ink and watercolor wash on oil cloth, 10 x 33". (Map 15)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Map showing part of the St. Anthony Falls Water Company's Property. Scale 1 inch= 60 feet. Colored inks on oil cloth, 24-1/2 x 40". (Map 16)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Map Showing the Location of the Minneapolis Union Railway and its Connections in the City of Minneapolis. Scale 1"=500'. Colored inks on oil cloth. 28 x 57". (Map 17)
(MINNESOTA) Noel, M. S. Chart Showing Tenny's Granite Ledges.... Scale 200 feet= 1 inch. Pen and watercolor wash on oil cloth, 23-1/4 x 34-1/2". (Map 18)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Part of Minneapolis Yard of Great Northern Ry. between Broadway and Monroe Str. Scale 1"=50'. Colored inks on oil cloth, 21 x 72". (Map 19)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Ditches built by the Red River Drainage Commission from 1894 to 1897. Colored inks on oil cloth, 12-3/4 x 48". Scale 1" + 6 miles. (Map 20)
(MINNESOTA) Stevens, Jno. F. Great Northern Ry. Plat Showing Tracks at Minneapolis Minn. Pen and ink on oil cloth, 21 x 44-1/2". (Map 21)
(MINNESOTA) Stevens, Jno. F. Great Northern Ry. Plat Showing Tracks at Minneapolis Minn. Pen and ink on oil cloth, 21 x 44-1/2". (Map 22)
(MINNESOTA) [Anon.] Minneapolis Hennepin County, Minnesota/ St. Paul Ramsey County, Minnesota. Colored inks on oil cloth, 37-1/2 x 135". (Map 23)
(MONTANA & IDAHO) [Anon.] [Untitled map of far northwestern Montana and a part of the Idaho panhandle.] Scale 1/2=1 mile. Ink on oil cloth, 26 x 36-1/2". (Map 24)
(MONTANA) Cartee, Ross. Sketch of County between Helena and Butte, made June 26, 1886 by A.B. Rogers. [Drawn] Sept 14, 1886 by Ross Cartee. Colored inks on oil cloth, 17 x 20-1/2". (Map 25)

(MONTANA) Carlee, Ross. [Untitled map of that portion of the route of the Northern Pacific R.R. along Silver Creek, Montana] [dated on verso: "Sept. 8, 1886"]. Scale 1"=800'. Colored inks on oil cloth, 14 x 57". (Map 26)

(MONTANA) Carlee, Ross. [Untitled map of that portion of the route of the Northern Pacific R.R. along Silver Creek, Montana] [dated on verso: "September 24, 1886"]. Scale 1"=400'. Colored inks on oil cloth, 19 x 83-1/2". (Map 27)
(MONTANA) Carlee, Ross. Map of Located Lines Marysville Branch Montana Central Railway Marysville. Scale 1"=200'. (Map 28)
(MONTANA) Carlee, Ross. [on verso: Mines near Marysville. Nov. 11, 1886]. Colored inks on oil cloth, 19-1/2 x 36-1/2". (Map 29)
(MONTANA) Carlee, Ross. Plan of Depot Ground at Marysville. Scale 1" = 100'. Colored inks on oil cloth, 14 x 27-1/2". (Map 30)
(MONTANA) [Anon.] Map of a Portion of Montana Territory. Scale 1"=6 miles. Colored inks on oil cloth, 21-1/4 x 31-1/4". (Map 31)
(MONTANA) U.S. Surveyor General's Office. Helena, Montana Territory. Poor Man Min. [Mining] Dis. [District] T.13N.R8W Unsurveyed. Pencil and pen and ink on oil cloth, 21 x 39-1/2". (Map 32)
(MONTANA) Roberts, E. J. Montana Extension. The Saint Paul, Minneapolis and Manitoba Ry. Co. Scale 12 miles to 1 inch. Colored inks on oil cloth, 20-1/2 x 65". (Map 33)

(MONTANA) Bischoff, A. Map of North- West part of Montana...Great Northern Line St. Paul, Minneapolis & Manitoba Ry. Pacific Extension. Elbridge H. Beckler, Chief Engineer. Helena, Mont. Scale 1 in.= 2 miles. Pen and ink on oil cloth, 27-1/2 x 36". (Map 34)
(MONTANA) [Untitled map of a part of northwestern Montana] Ink on oil cloth, 26-1/4 x 32-1/2". (Map 35)
(MONTANA) [Anon.] [Untitled map of a part of north central Montana.] Ink on oil cloth, 26-1/2 x 36 1/2. (Map 36)

(OREGON) Thielsen, H. Columbia River Division Northern Pacific Railroad Map Showing Location of Third Section of 2 and 41/100 Miles between Portland and Koloma. Scale 2000' to 1". Pen and watercolor wash on oil cloth. 10-1/2 x 10-1/2" map on 25 x 36" sheet with extensive text. (Map 37)

(OREGON & WASHINGTON) [Anon.] Map of Constructed Line. Northern Pacific Railroad Company. From the 102.87 to the 144.49 Mile Eastwardly From New Tacoma Scale = 4000 feet to 1 inch. Colored inks and pencil on oil cloth, 25 x 60". (Map 38)

(WASHlNGTON) [Anon. (initialed "C.F.H.")] Map Showing Extension of Spokane and Palouse R.R. from Belmont to Genesee in Washington Ter. St. Paul. Colored inks on oil cloth, 19 x 56". Scale 1 inch=4000 ft. (Map 39)
(WASHINGTON) [Anon.] Sketch of Country North of Spokane Wash. Helena Mont. Colored inks on oil cloth, 28 x 33". (Map 40)
(WASHINGTON) [Anon.] Plat showing Right of Way Required on Branch Line to Granby Smelter. Scale 1 in.=800 ft. Colored inks and pencil on oil cloth, 24 x 29-1/2". (Map 41)

(WASHINGTON) Hogeland, A. H. Located Line of the Washington and Great Northern Ry. Co. from International Boundary Line, Westerly and Southwesterly to Oroville, Washington. 1st Section. Colored inks on oil cloth, 16-1/4 x 56". (Map 42)

(WASHINGTON) Hogeland, A.H. Located Line of the Washington & Great Northern Ry. Co. from Oroville to International Boundary Line Washington 2nd Section. Colored inks on oil cloth, 16-1/4 x 56". (Map 43)
(WISCONSIN) [Anon.] West Superior Third Division...Douglas County, Wisconsin. Colored inks on oil cloth, 21 x 29". Scale 200'=1". (Map 44)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The title of each map includes the number supplied by the dealer. A list of the maps, with detailed descriptions by the dealer, is available in box 1.
